intro: Thymus tomentosus var. virescens, commonly known as green-haired thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features dense, woolly foliage that is typically a gray-green color, giving it its common name. The leaves are aromatic, containing essential oils that contribute to its distinctive fragrance. It produces small, pinkish-white flowers in spring, which attract pollinators like bees. This variety is often used in culinary and medicinal applications due to its flavorful and therapeutic properties.
